parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.shape.Definitions with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.gantt.shape.Shape.extend.

methods.name: getChildTagName

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of the childTagName property.

The 'defs' element is a container element for referenced elements. The content model for 'defs' is the same as that for the 'g' element; thus, any element that can be a child of a 'g' can also be a child of a 'defs'. The 'childTagName' is the name of any child element of 'defs'.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description:
Gets current value of property content.

Definition string. Subclasses can implement their own getters of this property to override the one in this class.

Default value is empty string.

SVG tag name of the shape. Note: We do not recommend that you change this value using a configuration or coding.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.ext.TextRepeat
symbols.description: A TextRepeat definition shape is used to define graphic objects which can be replicated ("tiled") at fixed intervals in the x and y axes to cover the areas to be painted. The text patterns are defined using a 'pattern' element and then referenced by the 'fill' and 'stroke' properties on a given graphics element to indicate that the element will be filled or stroked with the referenced pattern.

symbols.title: class sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcUsedPolygon

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UtilizationBarChart
symbols.description:
UBC is a complex shape. This class is the outer container with tag='g'. All fragments are aggregated into this container. You can remove a fragment from the container if your application does not need it.

The container has six aggregations:

  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcOverCapacityZonePolygon(used to represent the OverCapacity Zone area),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcUnderCapacityZonePolygon(used to represent the Unplanned Capacity area),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcShortageCapacityPolygon(used to the draw Shortage area),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcUsedPolygon(used to represent the HealthyPlanned Capacity area),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcBorderPath(used to represent the planned capacity line),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcTooltipRectangle(used to represent a rectangle with invisible tooltips for each period of capacity change).

A super class sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcPolygon is abstracted because the four polygons in this container (UbcOverCapacityZonePolygon, UbcUnderCapacityZonePolygon, UbcShortageCapacityPolygon, and UbcUsedPolygon) share similar logic.

Graphic Effect is:

An example of the structure of data to feed utilization bar chart:
{ bc_capacity: { id: "capacity_0", period: [ { start_date: "20160123000000", supply: "9", demand: "7" },{ start_date: "20160127093400", supply: "8", demand: "8" } ] }, bc_tooltip: [ { start_date: "20160123000000", supply: "9", demand: "7", end_date: "20160127093400" },{ start_date: "20160127093400", supply: "8", demand: "8", start_date: "20160203134520" } ] }

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcDimension
symbols.description:
This shape is a container for sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcBorderPath, sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcOverClipRectangle, sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcUnderClipRectangle, sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcClipPath, sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcClipingPath.

For each dimension, it has two colors, one is OverCapacity and the other is UnderCapacity. When the UlcClipPath of a dimension and UlcOverClipRectangle overlap, which means the utilization rate is above 100%, the overlapped part will be colored by OverCapacity. The overlapped part of UlcClipPath and UlcUnderClipRectangle is colored by UnderCapacity.

UlcClipingPath is aggregated in UlcClipPath. UlcClipingPath and UlcBorderPath share the same value of property 'd'. UlcBorderPath is used to visualize the dimension line.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property stroke.

Standard SVG 'stroke' attribute. Note: You can provide the stroke with HTML colors and the URL reference to a paint server. Paint server definitions can be retrieved from paint servers rendered by sap.gantt.GanttChartContainer, sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable, or sap.gantt.GanttChart.

The default value is "#CAC7BA".

Gets the value of property strokeWidth.

Standard SVG 'stroke-width' attribute.

methods.name: getX1

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property x1.

x coordinate of the start of the line.

Usually an application does not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates the value of x1 by using the view boundary for the visible area in the Gantt Chart.

methods.name: getX2

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property x2.

x coordinate of the end of the line.

Usually an application does not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates the value of 'x2' by using the view boundary's terminal point, which is filtered by the visible area in a Gantt Chart.

methods.name: getY1

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property y1.

y coordinate of the start of the line.

At the top of each row, a certain amount of space (in the shape of a rectangular frame) is reserved for over capacity area. You can use 'maxVisibleRatio' in 'shapeConfig' to specify the amount of area to reserve. With the reserved area deducted from a row, the height of the middle line is set to 50% of the row height.

methods.name: getY2

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property y2.

y coordinate of the end of the line.

y2 shares the same value with y1.

symbols.title: class sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcUnderClipRectangle

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UtilizationLineChart
symbols.description:
ULC is a complex shape. This class is the outer container with tag='g'. All fragments are aggregated into this container. You can remove a fragment from the container if your application does not need it.

The container has four aggregations:

  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcMiddleLine(used to draw a middle line, which indicates the position of 50% utilization rate),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcOverCapacityZoneRectangle(used to draw over capacity Zone),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcDimension(used to draw Dimensions, OverCapacityClipping, and UnderCapacityClipping),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcTooltipRectangle(used to draw invisible tooltip rectangles for each period of capacity change).

Each dimension consists of UlcOverClipRectangle, UlcUnderClipRectangle, UlcClipPath, and UlcBorderPath. UlcClipingPath is aggregated in UlcClipPath.

A super class sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcRectangle is abstracted because the other four rectangles(UlcOverCapacityZoneRectangle, UlcOverClipRectangle, UlcUnderClipRectangle, and UlcTooltipRectangle) share similar logic.

Graphic Effect is:

An example for the structure of data to feed utilization chart:
{ order: [{ id: "ulc_0", util: [ { dimension: "util_volumn", values:[ { from: "20160123000000", to: "20160123000000", firstOne: true, value: 0 }, { from: "20160124071000", to: "20160124071000", value: 97.6 }, { from: "20160124071000", to: "20160127051300", firstOne: true, value: 97.6 },{ from: "20160127051300", to: "20160127051300", value: 97.6 },{ from: "20160128093312", to: "20160128093312", lastOne: true, value: 0 } ] },{ dimension: "util_mass", values:[ { from: "20160123000000", to: "20160123000000", firstOne: true, value: 0 } { from: "20160124071000", to: "20160124071000", value: 114.5 }, { from: "20160124071000", to: "20160127051300", value: 114.5 },{ from: "20160127051300", to: "20160127051300", value: 114.5 },{ from: "20160128093312", to: "20160128093312", lastOne: true, value: 0 } ] } ] }], tooltip: [ { from: "20160123000000", to: "20160124071000", firstOne: true, util_volumn: { previous: 0, next: 97.6 }, util_mass:{ previous: 0, next: 114.5 } },{ from: "20160124071000", to: "20160127051300", util_volumn: { val: 97.6 }, util_mass:{ val: 114.5 } },{ from: "20160127051300", to: "20160128093312", lastOne: true, util_volumn: { previous: 97.6, next: 0 }, util_mass:{ previous: 114.5, next: 0 } } ] }

symbols.title: class sap.gantt.shape.SelectedShape

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.Shape
symbols.description:
Base class for all shape classes.

Shape class is designed to describe how data should be visualized by an SVG tag. Most shape classes contain only properties and only one aggregation:

  • Some properties come from standard SVG attribute. Examples are fill, stroke etc.
  • Some properties designed to put Shape class into Gantt chart's coordinate system, especially the X axis called sap.gantt.misc.AxisTime. Examples are time, endTime etc.
  • Some properties are designed to provide some geometry attributes. Examples are side, center in some extend shapes.
  • Every shape has aggregation called selectedShape to provide a way to specify how selection of the shape should be designed.
  • Some container shapes like g and clippath has aggregation to aggregate other shapes in.

Because d3 is used underneath and d3 use array to do batch data-binding, therefore Shape classes are not designed in the way of SAPUI5 standard data-binding (one shape instance per data). Instead, each Shape instance stands for a particular way of visualize one data structure. And one Shape instance is used to draw a list of data by Drawers in Gantt chart.

Because of this specialty, application cannot instantiate a shape class directly. Instead they can use configuration sap.gantt.config.Shape to describe which Shape class is used to draw which data in what way. And pass this configuration to Gantt chart control by property shapes. Gantt chart control use these configurations to instatiate Shape instances and Drawers. Drawers consumes Shape instances to draw real SVG shapes.

Each shape classes are designed to support 'configuration-first' principle. So called configure is the shapeProperties property of sap.gantt.config.Shape. In this object property, application can provide following things:

  • A value. Example: {tooltip: 'svg rocks'}.
  • An attribute from data. Example: {time: {startTime}}
  • Formatted attribute from data. {tooltip: "{time:Timestamp} the stock price falls to {price:Number}."} The typed values are formatted by global legacy number, date and time configurations by sap.gantt.misc.Format.

In many applications, simple configuration or even binding cannot meet business requriement. Therefore applications are allowed to extend shapes and provide their own getter methods to effect all properties by data. For in row shapes, two parameters are injected to help application to do coding. All the shapes provided by Gantt chart follows 'configuration first' principle by invoking method _configFirst(). Meaning if application provide value by sap.gantt.config.Shape, the configuration over-write code logic in getters.

Note: Setter methods are only used for set default values. Because a Shape instance stands for a way of drawing. The instance self does not hold any status (property values). Meanwhile, all getter are injected with actual data and related informations to adapt to d3 paradigm.

aggregations.name: resizeShadowShape
aggregations.description:
Resize Shadow Shape.

Resize Shadow shape specifies how to draw the shadow highlight when resizing. Applications can implement it by extending sap.gantt.shape.ResizeShadowShape and configure it in sap.gantt.config.Shape.

aggregations.name: selectedShape
aggregations.description:
Selected Shape.

Selected shape specifies how to draw the selection high-light. Application can implement it by extending sap.gantt.shape.SelectedShape and configure it in sap.gantt.config.Shape.

parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.name: getIsBulk

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property isBulk.

Gantt chart do filtering of data by timestamp for performance sake. For simple shapes which has time or endTime provided, set this flag to false. For shapes (path or polygon) which connect a list of data, set this value to false. And if filtering is required to next level data, provide arrayAttribute, timeFilterAttribute and endTimeFilterAttribute in combination.

methods.name: getIsDuration

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property isDuration.

When this flag is set to true, the shape is called 'duration shape'. And time stands for startTime, endTime stands for end time. When this flag is set to be false, the shape is called 'transient shape'. And only time is used. Usually these 3 properties are used to determine x position of one shape.

methods.name: getLegend
methods.description:
Gets legend value of property legend.

Specifies the legend text of the shape.

methods.description:

The referenceId, which is related to shape data, is generated by a Group shape. Aggregation shapes can use this method to retrieve the referenceId.

methods.name: getResizeShadowShape
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation resizeShadowShape.

Resize Shadow Shape.

Resize Shadow shape specifies how to draw the shadow highlight when resizing. Applications can implement it by extending sap.gantt.shape.ResizeShadowShape and configure it in sap.gantt.config.Shape.

methods.name: getRotationAngle

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property rotationAngle.

This value is used in combination of property rotationCenter. By providing both shape can be rotated with any angle around rotation center.

methods.name: getRotationCenter

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property rotationCenter.

This value is used in combination of property rotationAngle. By providing both shape can be rotated with any angle around rotation center. Default implementation is the coordinate at time in x coordinate, and rowYCenter in y coordinate. If application over-write this property by configuration or code, the logic cannot be guaranteed.

methods.name: getRowYCenter

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property rowYCenter.

Default implementation is return the middle position of the row in y direction. If application over-write this property by configuration or code, the logic cannot be guaranteed.

methods.description:

Selected Shape.

Title is visualized as tooltip by browser. Notes: Use character entity to do simple text tabbing and breaking. (Use " " for tab and " " for break.)

methods.name: getTransform

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property transform.

Standard SVG 'transform' attribute. Some logic in getTransform() is provided to enable property rotationCenter and rotationAngle. If application over-write this property by configuration or coding, rotation behavior cannot be guaranteed.

methods.name: getXBias

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property xBias.

Fine-tune x coordinate. This value only works for category inRowShape. Shape usually determines position in x coordinate by property isDuration, time and endTime. Application can use this property to do some x coordinate adjustment in pixel. The xBias will be automatically mirrored for RTL mode. It means if you set 10 to property xBias, in RTL mode, the value of the xBias will be -10.

methods.name: getYBias

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property yBias.

Fine-tune y coordinate. This value only works for category inRowShape. Y coordinate is automatically determined by row. Application can use this property to do some y coordinate adjustment in pixel.

Shape Categories.

Different categories use different Drawers. Therefore, different categories may have different designs of parameters in their getter methods.

properties.description: Shapes attached to one row.

properties.name: sap.gantt.shape.ShapeCategory.Relationship
properties.description: Relationship shapes connecting two in-row shape instances.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.Text
symbols.description: Text shape class using SVG tag 'text'. This shape is usually used to represent points in time.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new Text class.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.gantt.shape.Shape.extend.

methods.name: getEllipsisWidth

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property ellipsisWidth.

Ellipsis width if truncate happens. Default value 12 indicates 12px length reserved for ellipsis. If the value is -1, no ellipsis appears even truncate happens. If the value is bigger than -1, ellipsis will be 3 dots in length of this value.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:

SVG tag name of the shape. Note: We do not recommend that you change this value using a configuration or coding.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:

Text string.

methods.name: getTextAnchor

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property textAnchor.

Text anchor. Possible values are 'start', 'middle', and 'end'.

methods.name: getTruncateWidth

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property truncateWidth.

Truncating width. Default value -1 indicates truncating function is not activated. To enable truncating, give a truncate width here. If text length exceeds truncate width, text is truncated.

methods.name: getX

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property x.

x coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the rectangle.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

methods.name: getY

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property y.

y coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the rectangle.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using parameter oRowInfo and property height to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseConditionalShape
symbols.description: A conditional shape renders one of the sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape shapes assigned to it using the activeShape property. This allows you to switch between shapes based on properties from data binding.

properties.name: activeShape
properties.description: Defines which shape from the shapes aggregation is visible. If you specify a negative value or a value that is greater than the number of shapes defined, no shape will be rendered.

properties.name: countInBirdEye
properties.description:
Specifies whether or not the system takes this shape into account at the bird's eye zoom level.
We suggest that you set this property to true only for shapes that really need to be considered when in the bird's eye view.

This property is overwritten by property countInBirdEye of the activeShape shape from the shapes aggregation.
For setting this property, use the setter method of the active shape. The getter method returns the property value of the active shape.

aggregations.name: shapes
aggregations.description: A list of base shapes to switch between. Only one of these shapes will be rendered based on the activeShape property.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle
symbols.description: BaseRectangle represent a basic shape that creates rectangles, defined by corner positions, width and height. The rectangle may have their corners rounded.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
height defines the vertical length of the rectangle.

By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height.

properties.name: rx
properties.description: rx defines a radius on the x-axis.

properties.name: ry
properties.description: ry defines a radius on the y-axis.

properties.name: width
properties.description: width defines the horizontal length of the rectangle. Most of time it's calculated by properties time and endTime automatically

properties.name: x
properties.description: x defines a x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system

properties.name: y
properties.description: defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new BaseRectangle class.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape.extend.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property height.

If property height set to "auto", then the height is automatically calculated based on the row height.

methods.description:

rx defines a radius on the x-axis.

methods.name: getRy
methods.description:
Gets current value of property ry.

ry defines a radius on the y-axis.

Default value is 0.

methods.name: getWidth
methods.description:
Gets the value of property width.

Width of the rectangle.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using properties time and endTime

methods.name: getX
methods.description:
Gets the value of property x.

x coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time as a base.

methods.name: getY
methods.description:
Gets the value of property y.

y coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation based on the row height and uses height value to position the rectangle in the row center.

methods.name: setHeight

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property height.

height defines the vertical length of the rectangle.

By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is auto.

symbols.title: class sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape
symbols.description:
BaseShape is an abstract class. All other shapes must extend this class and provide implementation of method renderElement. It enables application developers to define it's own shapes.

This class provides the common used properties and methods.

properties.name: connectable
properties.description: Specifies whether the shape is connectable. When this property is set to true, you can connect two different shapes to create a relationship

properties.name: countInBirdEye
properties.description: Specifies whether or not the system takes this shape into account when performing a bird eye zooming. We suggest that you set this property to true only for shapes that really need to be considered into bird eye range.

properties.name: draggable
properties.description: Specifies whether the shape is draggable a draggble shape requires the shape is selectable set true as well.

properties.name: endTime
properties.description: end time of the shape. This property is mandatory if the shape is a duration shape. The duration is determined by minusing the value of property time

properties.name: expandable
properties.description: Whether the shape is expandable

properties.name: fill
properties.description:
The fill property enables you to define the fill color for shapes and texts.

For shapes and text the fill property is a presentation attribute that lets define the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns)

properties.name: fillOpacity
properties.description: The fillOpacity property is a presentation property defining the opacity of the paint server (color, gradient, pattern, etc) applied to a shape.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: The filter property defines the filter effects defined by the element that shall be applied to its element

properties.name: hoverable
properties.description: Specifies whether the shape is hoverable. hovering the mouse pointer over the shape fires the shapeMouseEnter event and moving the mouse pointer out of the shape fires the shapeMouseLeave event.

properties.name: opacity
properties.description:
The opacity attribute specifies the transparency of an object or of a group of objects, that is, the degree to which the background behind the element is overlaid.

The minimum value is 0.0 and maximum value is 1.0

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: Specifies whether the shape is resizable. Resizing a shape requires the shape is selectable as well.

properties.name: rowYCenter
properties.description: rowYCenter of the shape

properties.name: scheme
properties.description:
Scheme key of the shape.

The scheme is used by expand/collapse the main row shape. You can define the scheme together with shapeSchemes in sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the value defines here needse matchs the key value defines in sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme

properties.name: selectable
properties.description: Whether the shape is selectable

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Whether the shape is selected

properties.name: shapeId
properties.description: ID of the shape. shapeId property represents a unique identifier for a business object. This property shall be bound to a property during initialization, it requires an unique non-empty value.

properties.name: stroke
properties.description: The stroke property is a presentation property defining the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) used to paint the outline of the shape;

properties.name: strokeDasharray
properties.description: The strokeDasharray property is a presentation property defining the pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of the shape.

properties.name: strokeOpacity
properties.description: stroke opacity of the shape

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: The strokeWidth property is a presentation property defining the width of the stroke to be applied to the shape.

properties.name: time
properties.description: Start time of the shape. This property is mandatory, you must bind this property to a model or set a valid JavaScript Date object. The value will be converted to x coordination when rendering. If not set, the shape is not visible.

properties.name: transform
properties.description: The transform property defines a list of transform definitions that are applied to an element and the element's children Right now in gantt library, only translate() method is supported. CSS methods like scale, skew, rotate and matrix doesn't support. And if you provide values for transform, the values will update xBias and yBias if translate the corresponding axis is matched.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Shows or hides the shape.

properties.name: xBias
properties.description: X offset in pixel. If the value is positive, in non-RTL mode, means to translate the visual object to the right in pixel unit. If the value is negative, the logic is inverted.

properties.name: yBias
properties.description: Y offset in pixel. If the value is positive, in non-RTL mode, it means translate the visual object to the bottom in pixel unit. If the value is negative, the logic is inverted.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new Shape class

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape.extend

parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Element.extend.

symbols.title: abstract class sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseText
symbols.description: BaseText defines a graphics element consisting of text.

properties.name: fontFamily
properties.description: This property indicates which font family will be used to render the text, specified as a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names

properties.name: fontSize
properties.description: The fontSize property refers to the size of the font

properties.name: showEllipsis
properties.description: Flag to show the ellipsis symbol.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text content

properties.name: textAnchor
properties.description: This property is used to align (start-, middle- or end-alignment) a string of text relative to a given point

properties.name: truncateWidth
properties.description: The width to start truncate the text. If the value is omit, the text is truncated base on it's parent width

properties.name: x
properties.description: x-axis coordinate

properties.name: y
properties.description: y-axis coordinate

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new BaseText class.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape.extend.

methods.name: getFontFamily
methods.description:
Gets current value of property fontFamily.

This property indicates which font family will be used to render the text, specified as a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names

Default value is Arial.

methods.name: getFontSize
methods.description:
Gets current value of property fontSize.

The fontSize property refers to the size of the font

Default value is 13.

methods.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseText.getMetadata
methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.simple.BaseText.

methods.name: getShowEllipsis
methods.description:

Default value is true.

methods.description: Get the BaseText style string

methods.name: getText
methods.description:
Gets current value of property text.

Text content

methods.name: getTextAnchor
methods.description: Gets the value of property textAnchor.

methods.name: getTruncateWidth
methods.description:
Gets the value of property truncateWidth.

Truncating width. Default value -1 indicates truncating function is not activated. To enable truncating, specifies a truncate width. If text length exceeds truncate width, text is truncated automatically. This method will return the minimum between property truncateWidth and it's parent's width caculated by time range.

methods.name: getX
methods.description:
Gets current value of property x.

x coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the text.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time from itself or it's parent that has method getTime. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

methods.name: getY
methods.description:
Gets current value of property y.

y coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the text.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using parameter RowYCenter and property fontSize to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

symbols.title: class sap.gantt.simple.BaseText

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.ContainerToolbar
symbols.description:
ContainerToolbar is be used with GanttChartContainer control. Use this control out of sap.gantt library is not supported.

It's defined as an aggregation of GanttChartContainer to provide actions to all sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable instances. By default, it only shows zooming controls and settings button. You can set properties to true to show more build-in buttons.

properties.name: alignCustomContentToRight
properties.description:
Defines how the toolbar custom content is aligned.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.DimensionLegend
symbols.description:
Dimension Legend provides a template for two-dimension legends. This template defines the representation (shape, pattern, and color) of individual legend items and their corresponding meanings in both dimensions.

Consider that you need to create a legend where legend items represent both the type and status of an object. In this case, you can configure column to indicate object statuses and row to indicate object types. Assume that valid object types are "Freight Order", "Freight Unit", and "Trailer Unit"; valid object statuses are "Executed", "In Execution", "Fixed", "Planned", and Unplanned. You will have a three by four two-dimension legend containing twelve legend items. Each them represents an object in a specific type and a specific status. For example, a red square stands for executed freight orders.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer
symbols.description: A container that holds one or more sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable instances.

properties.name: displayType
properties.description:
Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.

  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
This property overrides the displayType properties of individual Gantt charts included in the ganttCharts aggregation.

properties.name: enableAdhocLine
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: enableCursorLine
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable the cursor line that follows the cursor.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: enableNowLine
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable the present time indicator.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: enableTimeScrollSync
properties.description: Flag to enable and disable scroll synchronization by time on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: enableVerticalLine
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
height of the container.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.

properties.name: layoutOrientation
properties.description: The GanttChartContainer use Splitter to manager the layout, it can have horizontal or vertical orientation. Note: the property only take effect if GanttChartContainer has more than 1 ganttChart instances

properties.name: width
properties.description:
width of the container.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the width to work as expected, the width of the surrounding container must be defined.

aggregations.name: ganttCharts
aggregations.description: Gantt Chart of the container

aggregations.name: svgDefs
aggregations.description: Definitions of paint servers used for advanced shape features around SVG fill, stroke, and filter attributes. The generated SVG will be reused in all gantt chart instances

aggregations.name: toolbar
aggregations.description: Toolbar of the container.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new Gantt chart container.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: customSettingChange
events.description:
Event fired when the custom settings value is changed.

The custom settings are application provided settings that can be configured in the settings dialog. This event allows the application to handle these settings. Only check boxes are supported.

Attaches event handler fnFunction to the customSettingChange event of this sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer itself.

Event fired when the custom settings value is changed.

The custom settings are application provided settings that can be configured in the settings dialog. This event allows the application to handle these settings. Only check boxes are supported.

methods.name: getDisplayType
methods.description:
Gets current value of property displayType.

Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.

  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
This property overrides the displayType properties of individual Gantt charts included in the ganttCharts aggregation.

Default value is Both.

methods.name: getEnableAdhocLine
methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableAdhocLine.

Flag to enable and disable adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableCursorLine
methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableCursorLine.

Flag to enable and disable the cursor line that follows the cursor.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableNowLine
methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableNowLine.

Flag to enable and disable the present time indicator.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableTimeScrollSync
methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableTimeScrollSync.

Flag to enable and disable scroll synchronization by time on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableVerticalLine
methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableVerticalLine.

Flag to enable and disable vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getGanttCharts
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation ganttCharts.

Gantt Chart of the container

methods.name: getHeight
methods.description:
Gets current value of property height.

height of the container.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.

Default value is 100%.

methods.name: getLayoutOrientation
methods.description:
Gets current value of property layoutOrientation.

The GanttChartContainer use Splitter to manager the layout, it can have horizontal or vertical orientation. Note: the property only take effect if GanttChartContainer has more than 1 ganttChart instances

Default value is Vertical.

symbols.title: class sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable
symbols.description: The Gantt Chart control provides a comprehensive set of features to display hierarchical data and a visulized shapes together. It's designed to fully support OData binding, declaring hierarchical data and shapes bindings in XML view. It's the recommented control for new applications.

properties.name: adhocLineLayer
properties.description: Specifies on which layer adhoc lines reside. By default, adhoc lines are on top of all other shapes and patterns.

properties.name: disableShapeDoubleClickEvent
properties.description: Disables or enables the shapeDoubleClick event. If set to true, the shapeDoubleClick event is disabled.

properties.name: displayType
properties.description:
Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.

  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer, this property overrides the displayType property of sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer.

properties.name: dragOrientation
properties.description:
Drag orientation of Gantt Chart.

This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:

  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.

properties.name: enableAdhocLine
properties.description: Flag to show or hide adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis

properties.name: enableCursorLine
properties.description: Flag whether to show or hide the cursor line when moving your mouse cursor

properties.name: enableNowLine
properties.description: Flag whether to show or hide the present time indicator.

properties.name: enableVerticalLine
properties.description: Flag to show or hide vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis

properties.name: ghostAlignment
properties.description: The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event shapeDragEnd

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the control.

properties.name: nowLineInUTC
properties.description:
Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in local time.

Since: 1.68.

properties.name: selectionPanelSize
properties.description:
The width of selection panel.

In sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the selectionPanelSize is the Table/TreeTable width in the embedded Splitter.

properties.name: shapeSelectionMode
properties.description:
Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed.

The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true.

properties.name: shapeSelectionSettings
properties.description:
A JSON object containing the shapeSelectionSettings which will be used to configure shape selection styles. If nothing is specified, then the default selection styles (2px dashed red border) is set.

Below you can find a brief example 


{
   color: "#808080",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
}

properties.name: showShapeTimeOnDrag
properties.description: Flag to show or hide the start time and end time of a shape when you drag it along the time line

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the control.

aggregations.name: _header
aggregations.description: Header of the Gantt Chart

aggregations.name: _innerGantt
aggregations.description: Inner Gantt chart

aggregations.name: _splitter
aggregations.description: private aggregation for resizing the selection panel

aggregations.name: adhocLines
aggregations.description: The aggregation is used to store configuration of adhoc lines, adhoc lines represent milestones and events in axis time.

aggregations.name: axisTimeStrategy
aggregations.description: This aggregation controls the zoom strategies and zoom rate in Gantt Chart.

aggregations.name: calendarDef
aggregations.description:
Paint servers consumed by special shape sap.gantt.shape.cal.Calendar.

This aggregation is designed to improve performance of calendar shapes. Rows usually share a similar definition with calendar shapes. It is possible to define a Calendar paint server to draw only one rectangle for each row. Notes for classes extended from sap.gantt.def.cal.CalendarDef: Different from property paintServerDefs, paint servers defined here must implement method getDefNode() instead of method getDefString().

aggregations.name: locale
aggregations.description:
Configuration of locale settings.

Most locale settings can be configured in sap.ui.configuration objects. Only the time zone and day-light-saving time options are provided by locale settings. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Locale. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

aggregations.name: shapeSchemes
aggregations.description:
Shape schemes of Gantt Chart.

Defines all the possible shape schemes in the Gantt chart control. Note:If you don't use expand chart, you can omit this aggregations. If not set, a default sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme is provided automatically.

aggregations.name: svgDefs
aggregations.description:
SVG reusable element definitions.

If this property is provided, the paint server definition of the SVG is rendered. Method getDefString() should be implemented by all paint server classes that are passed in in this property. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.def.SvgDefs. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

aggregations.name: table
aggregations.description:
Table of the Gantt Chart

You can use {sap.ui.table.Table} if you have a flat list data or {sap.ui.table.TreeTable} if you have hierarchical data.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new Gantt Chart

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: dragStart

parameters.name: draggedShapeDates
parameters.description:
Object of dragged shapes dates, it's structured as follows: 

{
    "shapeUid1": {
         "time": date1,
         "endTime": date2,
    },
    "shapeUid2": {
         "time": date3,
         "endTime": date4,
    },
}

You can't get all selected shape instances because scrolling might destroy shapes on the invisible rows.

parameters.name: lastDraggedShapeUid
parameters.description: The last shape out of those being dragged.

parameters.name: cursorDateTime
parameters.description: Represents the mouse pointer's date & time when the dragStart event was fired.

events.description: Event fired when a drag-and-drop begins

events.name: shapeConnect

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The value comes from sap.gantt.simple.RelationshipType, which represents type of relationship

events.description: Event fired when one shape dragged and connected to another shape.

events.name: shapeContextMenu

parameters.name: pageX
parameters.description: The mouse position relative to the left edge of the document.

parameters.name: pageY
parameters.description: The mouse position relative to the top edge of the document.

parameters.name: popoverOffsetX
parameters.description: Offset for an sap.m.Popover placement on the x axis, in pixels.

events.description: This event is fired when you right-click the shape.

events.name: shapeDoubleClick

parameters.name: popoverOffsetX
parameters.description: Offset for an sap.m.Popover placement on the x axis, in pixels.

events.description: This event is fired when a shape is double-clicked or double-tapped.

events.name: shapeDrop

parameters.name: draggedShapeDates
parameters.description:
Object of dragged shapes date, it's structure is: 

{
    "shapeUid1": {
         "time": date1,
         "endTime": date2,
    },
    "shapeUid2": {
         "time": date3,
         "endTime": date4,
    },
}

It's impossible to get all selected shape instances because of scrolling might destroy shapes on the invisible rows

parameters.name: targetRow
parameters.description: The target row of gantt chart. No source row because of user might drag multiple shapes on different rows.

parameters.name: cursorDateTime
parameters.description: Represent the cursor date & time when drop event fired

parameters.name: newDateTime
parameters.description:
The startTime or endTime of a dropped shape. In Free or Horizontal drag orientation, the value depends on the ghost alignment:

  • Start: newDateTime is the shape new start time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime
  • None: newDateTime is the shape new start time
  • End: newDateTime is the shape new end time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime

In Veritcal drag orientation, newDateTime is the shape new start time, and not equal with cursorDateTime in usual.

parameters.name: targetShape
parameters.description: Represents the shape which the dragged shape dropped on.

events.description: Event fired when a drag-and-drop occurs on one or more selected shapes.

events.name: shapeMouseEnter

parameters.name: shape
parameters.description: The data of the shape which fires this event.

parameters.name: pageX
parameters.description: The mouse position relative to the left edge of the document.

parameters.name: pageY
parameters.description: The mouse position relative to the top edge of the document.

events.description: Event fired when a shape is hovered over.

events.name: shapeMouseLeave
events.description: Fired when the mouse pointer leaves the shape.

events.name: shapePress

parameters.name: popoverOffsetX
parameters.description: Offset for an sap.m.Popover placement on the x axis, in pixels.

parameters.name: rowSettings
parameters.description: Row settings of the row that has been clicked or tapped.

parameters.name: shape
parameters.description: Instance of the shape that has been clicked or tapped.

events.description: This event is fired when a shape is clicked or tapped.

events.name: shapeResize

parameters.name: oldTime
parameters.description: Original shape time array, including the start time and end time.

parameters.name: newTime
parameters.description: New shape time array, including the start time and end time.

events.description: Fired when a shape is resized.

events.name: shapeSelectionChange
events.description: Fired when the shape selection of the gantt chart has been changed.

events.name: visibleHorizonUpdate

parameters.name: lastVisibleHorizon
parameters.description: Value of the visible horizon before the current update. Some types of this event don't have this value.

parameters.name: currentVisibleHorizon
parameters.description: Value of the visible horizon after the current update.

events.description:
This event is fired when the visible horizon is changed.

Since: 1.68.

parameters.description:
Object of dragged shapes dates, it's structured as follows: 

{
    "shapeUid1": {
         "time": date1,
         "endTime": date2,
    },
    "shapeUid2": {
         "time": date3,
         "endTime": date4,
    },
}

You can't get all selected shape instances because scrolling might destroy shapes on the invisible rows.

parameters.description:
Object of dragged shapes date, it's structure is: 

{
    "shapeUid1": {
         "time": date1,
         "endTime": date2,
    },
    "shapeUid2": {
         "time": date3,

It's impossible to get all selected shape instances because of scrolling might destroy shapes on the invisible rows

parameters.name: targetRow
parameters.description: The target row of gantt chart. No source row because of user might drag multiple shapes on different rows.

parameters.name: cursorDateTime
parameters.description: Represent the cursor date & time when drop event fired

parameters.name: newDateTime
parameters.description:
The startTime or endTime of a dropped shape. In Free or Horizontal drag orientation, the value depends on the ghost alignment:

  • Start: newDateTime is the shape new start time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime
  • None: newDateTime is the shape new start time
  • End: newDateTime is the shape new end time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime

In Veritcal drag orientation, newDateTime is the shape new start time, and not equal with cursorDateTime in usual.

parameters.name: targetShape
parameters.description: Represents the shape which the dragged shape dropped on.

methods.name: getAdhocLineLayer
methods.description:
Gets current value of property adhocLineLayer.

Specifies on which layer adhoc lines reside. By default, adhoc lines are on top of all other shapes and patterns.

Default value is sap.gantt.AdhocLineLayer.Top.

methods.name: getAdhocLines
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation adhocLines.

The aggregation is used to store configuration of adhoc lines, adhoc lines represent milestones and events in axis time.

methods.name: getAxisTime
methods.description: This is a shortcut method for GanttChart instance to get the AxisTime.

methods.name: getAxisTimeStrategy
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation axisTimeStrategy.

This aggregation controls the zoom strategies and zoom rate in Gantt Chart.

methods.name: getCalendarDef
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation calendarDef.

Paint servers consumed by special shape sap.gantt.shape.cal.Calendar.

This aggregation is designed to improve performance of calendar shapes. Rows usually share a similar definition with calendar shapes. It is possible to define a Calendar paint server to draw only one rectangle for each row. Notes for classes extended from sap.gantt.def.cal.CalendarDef: Different from property paintServerDefs, paint servers defined here must implement method getDefNode() instead of method getDefString().

methods.name: getDisableShapeDoubleClickEvent
methods.description:
Gets current value of property disableShapeDoubleClickEvent.

Disables or enables the shapeDoubleClick event. If set to true, the shapeDoubleClick event is disabled.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getDisplayType
methods.description:
Gets current value of property displayType.

Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.

  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer, this property overrides the displayType property of sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer.

Default value is Both.

methods.name: getDragOrientation
methods.description:
Gets current value of property dragOrientation.

Drag orientation of Gantt Chart.

This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:

  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.

Default value is Free.

methods.name: getEnableAdhocLine
methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableAdhocLine.

Flag to show or hide adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableCursorLine
methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableCursorLine.

Flag whether to show or hide the cursor line when moving your mouse cursor

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableNowLine
methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableNowLine.

Flag whether to show or hide the present time indicator.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableVerticalLine
methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableVerticalLine.

Flag to show or hide vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis

Default value is true.

methods.name: getGhostAlignment
methods.description:
Gets current value of property ghostAlignment.

The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event shapeDragEnd

Default value is sap.gantt.dragdrop.GhostAlignment.None.

methods.name: getHeight
methods.description:
Gets current value of property height.

Height of the control.

Default value is 100%.

methods.name: getLocale
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation locale.

Configuration of locale settings.

Most locale settings can be configured in sap.ui.configuration objects. Only the time zone and day-light-saving time options are provided by locale settings. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Locale. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

methods.name: sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable.getMetadata
methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable.

methods.name: getNowLineInUTC
methods.description:
Gets current value of property nowLineInUTC.

Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in local time.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getSelectedShapeUid
methods.description: Get selected shapes in gantt chart.

methods.name: getSelectionPanelSize
methods.description:
Gets current value of property selectionPanelSize.

The width of selection panel.

In sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the selectionPanelSize is the Table/TreeTable width in the embedded Splitter.

Default value is 30%.

methods.name: getShapeSchemes
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation shapeSchemes.

Shape schemes of Gantt Chart.

Defines all the possible shape schemes in the Gantt chart control. Note:If you don't use expand chart, you can omit this aggregations. If not set, a default sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme is provided automatically.

methods.name: getShapeSelectionMode
methods.description:
Gets current value of property shapeSelectionMode.

Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed.

The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true.

Default value is MultiWithKeyboard.

methods.name: getShapeSelectionSettings
methods.description:
Gets current value of property shapeSelectionSettings.

A JSON object containing the shapeSelectionSettings which will be used to configure shape selection styles. If nothing is specified, then the default selection styles (2px dashed red border) is set.

Below you can find a brief example 


{
   color: "#808080",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
}

methods.name: getShowShapeTimeOnDrag
methods.description:
Gets current value of property showShapeTimeOnDrag.

Flag to show or hide the start time and end time of a shape when you drag it along the time line

Default value is false.

methods.name: getSvgDefs
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation svgDefs.

SVG reusable element definitions.

If this property is provided, the paint server definition of the SVG is rendered. Method getDefString() should be implemented by all paint server classes that are passed in in this property. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.def.SvgDefs. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

methods.name: getTable
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation table.

Table of the Gantt Chart

You can use {sap.ui.table.Table} if you have a flat list data or {sap.ui.table.TreeTable} if you have hierarchical data.

methods.name: getWidth
methods.description:
Gets current value of property width.

Width of the control.

Default value is 100%.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setGhostAlignment

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property ghostAlignment.

The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event shapeDragEnd

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is sap.gantt.dragdrop.GhostAlignment.None.

methods.name: setHeight

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property height.

Height of the control.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 100%.

methods.description: Sets the sap.ui.core.LayoutData defining the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a layout.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets the aggregated locale.

methods.name: setNowLineInUTC

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property nowLineInUTC.

Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in local time.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setSelectionPanelSize

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property selectionPanelSize.

The width of selection panel.

In sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the selectionPanelSize is the Table/TreeTable width in the embedded Splitter.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 30%.

methods.name: setShapeSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property shapeSelectionMode.

Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed.

The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is MultiWithKeyboard.

methods.name: setShapeSelectionSettings

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property shapeSelectionSettings.

A JSON object containing the shapeSelectionSettings which will be used to configure shape selection styles. If nothing is specified, then the default selection styles (2px dashed red border) is set.

Below you can find a brief example 


{
   color: "#808080",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
}

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setShowShapeTimeOnDrag

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showShapeTimeOnDrag.

Flag to show or hide the start time and end time of a shape when you drag it along the time line

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.GanttPrinting
symbols.description:
The GanttPrinting control enables you to export your Gantt chart as a PDF document.
Please note that the area of the chart that can be exported is limited to canvas area 16,384 x 16,384 pixels (268,435,456 square pixels).

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.LegendContainer
symbols.description:
The LegendContainer control uses the NavContainer control to handle hierarchical navigation between legend sections. The LegendContainer control contains an initial navigation page. Both the initial navigation page and legend sections are Page controls, We put the List Legend control inside the Page control internally.

If you only add one legend, the initial navigation page won't display. Whenever you open legend container, the legend container will restore the page last time you quit with.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the legend navigation. When the height specified is smaller than a section content, a vertical scroll bar appears.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.

aggregations.name: legends
aggregations.description: Legends inside the container, they could be instances of List Legend or Dimension Legend.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.ListLegendItem
symbols.description: Aggregation element for the List Legend. A List Legend Item consists of a marker and an associated text. The marker can be any shapes you in shape aggregation. If you need to interact with the legend item, set the interactive to true then the item will display a check box in front of the shape and text.

properties.description: Indicates whether the check box is visible or not.

Attaches event handler fnFunction to the interactiveChange event of this sap.gantt.simple.ListLegendItem.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.gantt.simple.ListLegendItem itself.

The event is raised when there is a click action on the checkbox before legend item.

symbols.description:
Base class for all standard shapes.

This class provides the common used properties and methods useful for shape rendering. Use this class as a parent of your custom shape implementations.

properties.description: Color to be used for rendering the shape.

properties.description: This property is ignored.

properties.description: This property is ignored.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Height defines the vertical length of the shape.

By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height.

properties.description: All standard shapes are hoverable.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart
symbols.description:
Utilization Line Chart (ULC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize resource utilization on different dimensions. Each Utilization dimension is represented by a line, you could define different colors for each dimension.

You can define the ULC background by property fill, the default background color is light gray

properties.name: showMiddleLine
properties.description: Flag to show or hide the middle line in Utilization Line Chart. The value of the overConsumptionMargin will affect the middle line position. By default the middle line is a gray dashed line

associations.name: overConsumptionPattern
associations.description:
The value for overConsuptionPattern can be either an UI5 ID which points to an instance of PatternBase which defined in svgDefs or an instance of PatternBase.

The overConsumptionPattern is visualized as rectangle which the height is calculated based on overConsumptionMargin

nodes.name: sap.gantt
nodes.description: UI5 library: sap.gantt.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.axistime.AxisTimeStrategyBase
nodes.description: Base class for all zoom strategies.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.axistime.FullScreenStrategy
nodes.description:
FullScreenStrategy

A zoom strategy that sets the value of totalHorizon to the value of visibleHorizon. When this strategy is implemented, visibleHorizon is fixed. Because of this, when you scroll the splitter to expand or shrink the chart area, the value of visibleHorizon remains intact, which makes shapes look larger or smaller accordingly. Moreover, the horizontal scroll bar never appears and the zoom control is deactivated.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.axistime.ProportionZoomStrategy
nodes.description:
ProportionZoomStrategy

A zoom strategy that provides the proportional change ability. Proportional change ensures that Gantt Chart dynamically adjusts the zoom rate to be the best fit for rendering shapes in the chart area. This strategy cannot be used by the Select control.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationBarChart
nodes.description:
Utilization Bar Chart (UBC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize a resource the capacity and actual consumption of a resource.

There is a `line` in UBC to visualize the actual capacity consumption, you can change the `line` color by property stroke

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationDimension

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart
nodes.description: Utilization Line Chart (ULC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize resource utilization on different dimensions.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationPeriod
nodes.description:
UtilizationPeriod is used by sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart and sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationBarChart It represents a time period that a specific resource utilization usages

UtilizationPeriod is either defined as a direct aggregation of UtilizationBarChart, or an aggregation of sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationDimension
